title: Angular momentum cons - 2 students on platform

content.question: Two students, <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>A</mtext></math> and <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>B</mtext></math>, stand at the opposite edges of a large circular platform. The platform is rotating at a constant angular velocity about a central vertical axle with negligible friction. Student <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>A</mtext></math> then moves inward, eventually reaching the center of the platform. During the time that Student <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>A</mtext></math> is moving inward, for which of the following systems, if any, is the angular momentum about the center of the platform constant?

choices.label: Student <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>B</mtext></math> and the platform only
Student <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>A</mtext></math>, Student <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>B</mtext></math>, and the platform
There is no system involving just the students and the platform for which angular momentum is constant.

content.answer: Student <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>A</mtext></math>, Student <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>B</mtext></math>, and the platform
